newsitem.title: FRANCE: Orbis DC10 flying hospital on view at Paris show.
newsitem.headline: Orbis DC10 flying hospital on view at Paris show.

text.p: U.S.-based humanitarian aid organisation, Orbis International, in association with Federal Express, is to display its specially adapted DC 10 "flying hospital" at Paris-Le Bourget airport Nov 26-27, Fedex said.
Fedex pays for medicines, other necessary supplies and maintenance of the DC10 which is equipped as an ophthalmic surgical unit for humanitarian aid missions to Third World countries.
The Houston, Texas based DC10 also serves as a training school and conference facility.
Under the motto "Fighting Blindness Worldwide", Orbis has conducted several round-the-world trips with the DC10 co-operating with 33,000 doctors and nurses in host countries.
"The skills acquired by medical corps via the training programmes aboard the DC10 has enabled them to cure around six million people suffering from eye disorders," a joint Orbis/Fedex statement said.
Orbis' 1996 missions schedule saw the DC10 stationed in India, Bangladesh, China, Mongolia, Kirghizia, Armenia and Ethiopia.
Orbis had operated a DC8 until 1992 when Fedex advised it on the acquisition of the DC10, a Fedex spokeswomen said. -- Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
